Description: Deep black-topped bowl with splayed walls, slight out-turning rim, made of Nile silt pottery, coated with red slip, blackened at rim on exterior and burnished. The interior is gray and plain, scraped to smooth.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Marked 1858 on base. Identified as like Black-top red ware B18k in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery by Baumgartel in Petrie’s Naqada Excavations: A Supplement (London 1970), p. lx
